definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
A relative afar is less use than a close neighbor (idiom). Take whatever help is on hand, even from strangers.
pinyin: yuan3 qin1 bu4 ru2 jin4 lin2

definition: the poor are ignored in the busiest city; the rich will find relatives in the deepest mountain
pinyin: qiong2 zai4 nao4 shi4 wu2 ren2 wen4 , fu4 zai4 shen1 shan1 you3 yuan3 qin1
containing_words.word: 窮在鬧市無人問，富在深山有遠親

sentences.english: Many distant relatives fawned on the rich old man.
sentences.chinese: 遠親都來巴結這位有錢的老人。

sentences.english: I have a distant relative in this small town.
sentences.chinese: 在這個小鎮上我有一個遠親。

sentences.english: An old saying goes that a near neighbor is better than a distant cousin. Having a good neighbor is lucky.
sentences.chinese: 俗話說“遠親不如近鄰”，有個好鄰居是件幸運的事。

sentences.english: An old saying goes that a near neighbor is better than a distant cousin.
sentences.chinese: 俗話說“遠親不如近鄰”，有個好鄰居是件幸運的事。

sentences.english: Then you must be my cousin.
sentences.chinese: 那麼你一定是我的遠親了。

definition: to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom); everything has its ancestral home/In old age, an expatriate longs to return home.
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
